Animal studies demonstrate improved motor function, nerve conduction, muscle reinnervation, and neural tissue coverage with the NGC. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to seat base support assemblies for furniture, particularly sinuous band seat spring assemblies, providing dynamic uplift and resilience through innovative rail connectors. These connectors combine torsioning, dynamic uplift, expansion-contraction, and leverage-amplification to enhance seat performance characteristics. </summary>

<summary> The disclosed anvil assembly for a surgical stapling device includes an anvil shaft with flexible legs and a stabilizing collet to prevent damage during attachment to the stapling device. The collet is positioned within the anvil shaft to support the flexible legs and minimize the likelihood of damage. The assembly also includes an anvil head assembly with an anvil plate for staple formation. The collet is cylindrical and substantially rigid, with cantilevered fingers to secure it within the anvil shaft. The assembly allows for reliable attachment of the anvil assembly to the stapling device, enhancing surgical procedures. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a container for a blender with high-speed blades mounted inside. Early blenders had glass containers, but manufacturers switched to reinforced plastic due to durability and cost efficiency. However, plastic containers could accumulate debris and compromise hygiene. To address this issue, a metal lining was introduced to shield the inner wall of the receptacle. The lining includes teeth for grinding fibers of vegetables and fruits, reducing blending time and preserving the juice's color and nutrients. Different embodiments of the container feature various designs for the lining, such as half-mask or whole-mask shapes, prop stands, and horizontal rings for stability. Overall, the invention aims to improve blending efficiency and maintain the quality of the juice produced. </summary>

<summary> The document describes a garnish pick with appendages that can serve as skewering shafts or hooks for securing the pick to a food or beverage container. The pick may have multiple appendages at different angles for holding garnishes and preventing the pick from becoming submerged in a beverage. Various embodiments show different configurations of the garnish pick, including curved shafts, multiple skewering shafts, and hooks for securing to glass rims. The pick may be made of materials such as wood, metal, plastic, or ceramic. The design of the garnish pick aims to make it easier to eat garnishes without touching them with fingers and to prevent the pick from sliding into the beverage. The document also describes specific embodiments of the garnish pick with curved shafts, multiple skewering shafts, and hooks for securing to glass rims. The pick body may include multiple elongate body portions branching from a stem portion, each forming tapered skewers for holding garnishes. Overall, the document provides detailed descriptions and illustrations of various embodiments of the garnish pick. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a combined cardiomyostimulator and cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator for cardiac assist systems. It includes a device and algorithm for delivering stimulation to a skeletal muscle grafted around the heart, sensing depolarizations of the heart, and providing appropriate therapies for different types of arrhythmias. The system features muscle stimulation while charging for defibrillation to maintain cardiac output and decrease defibrillation thresholds. Different muscle stimulation bursts can be used, such as muscle catch and pulse train bursts, to enhance the force of skeletal muscle contractions. The system also includes a synchronization sequence to deliver defibrillation discharge synchronized to a sensed cardiac event. Overall, the system allows for rapid detection of arrhythmias, provides cardiac assistance during arrhythmias, and minimizes interference with reliable sensing of cardiac events. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an accommodating intraocular lens device designed for implantation in a lens chamber of a subject's eye. The device comprises a lens chamber, a base lens, and a lens periphery coupling the two. The lens chamber is elastically deformable and filled with a fluid or gel, providing accommodative power. The base lens provides corrective refractive power and is more rigid than the lens chamber. The device is resiliently biased to an unaccommodated state but actuates to an accommodated state in response to radial compressive forces. Various embodiments include features such as through-holes, raised protrusions, and different materials with varying Young's modulus. The IOL is intended for implantation in the capsular bag of the eye, centered along the optical axis, and designed to provide a range of accommodation up to 15 diopters. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an esophageal-stomach displacement electrode designed to be inserted into a patient's esophagus and stomach to stimulate the heart in cooperation with an external chest electrode. The electrode includes a semi-rigid plastic tube with an electrode at the distal end, a mechanism to bend the distal end of the tube, and a control mechanism at the proximal end. By manipulating the control mechanism, the distal end of the tube can be bent to displace the stomach wall towards the heart, placing the electrode in an optimal position for pacing or defibrillation. The electrode is designed to reduce the amount of electrical energy needed for heart procedures and can be easily withdrawn after use. The invention provides a non-invasive and efficient method for positioning the electrode close to the heart, enhancing the effectiveness of medical procedures. Modifications can be made to the design without departing from the scope of the invention. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a board game with a lake theme, where players move tokens around a board to acquire lake areas, boat dealerships, and dams. Players can improve their properties by adding lake cabins and marinas, and must pay rent to other players when landing on their properties. The game continues until all but one player goes bankrupt, with the remaining player declared the winner. </summary>

<summary> The invention describes an apparatus and method for treating tissues and wounds by combining fluid supply and suction drainage, with features such as eliminating hydrostatic pressure, intermittent fluid administration, and detecting bleeding during treatment. The apparatus includes a movable rest for fluid reservoirs, an injection port for intermittent fluid supply, and a drainage port with an open grid to prevent occlusion, while the method involves controlling fluid flow rates, maintaining suction pressures, and monitoring fluid formation to detect bleeding. </summary>

<summary> The gravity driven steerable vehicle described is designed for downhill racing on varied terrain, with a prone riding position and a stable, durable design. The vehicle has at least two wheels or skis, a steering mechanism, and a braking system. The suspension system allows for precise control in turns, especially on snow-covered terrain. The vehicle can be retrofitted with components to create different configurations, such as skis in the front and wheels in the rear. Additional features include a roll bar, shock absorbers, and a harness for the rider. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography for imaging objects using wave-based algorithms. Conventional ultrasound imaging techniques suffer from limitations in detecting plaque types. The invention utilizes a wave-based imaging method to characterize plaque in arteries, determining the risk of rupture and thrombosis. The method involves directing energy waves radially outward and processing the received scattered waves to construct images. The invention can also be used for non-destructive evaluation in boreholes to track contaminants or characterize materials. The Hilbert Space Inverse Wave algorithm is employed to map angular locations and frequency parameters of the received waves for imaging. The method allows for flexible transducer configurations and frequency usage in the reconstruction process. </summary>

<summary> 
The present invention concerns a biological oil composition derived from a marine copepod, particularly rich in stearidonic acid (SDA), eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA). This oil composition has been found to have significant effects on preventing and treating cardiovascular diseases, particularly atherosclerosis and hypercholesterolemia. The composition contains high levels of wax esters and is distinct from other marine oils in its chemical composition. Studies in female mice have shown that the copepod oil reduces atherosclerotic plaque formation and lowers blood cholesterol levels compared to a concentrated EPA/DHA preparation. The oil composition is suitable for use in dietary supplements, functional foods, and pharmaceutical products for cardiovascular health. The unique biological effects of the copepod oil suggest potential therapeutic benefits beyond traditional marine oils. </summary>

<summary> 
The invention relates to pharmacological compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes in microparticulate form with active substances embedded in the matrix. These complexes can be composed of biocompatible, biodegradable polyacids and polybases, with the active substance either embedded, absorbed, chemically bound, or a partner in the complex. The particles can be prepared in various sizes and are suitable for controlled release of active substances like cytostatics, proteins, vaccines, and antibiotics. The release profiles can be adjusted by the composition of the complex. The microparticles have shown potential as injectable depot forms, wound ointments, and ultrasonic contrast agents. Release tests have demonstrated controlled and sustained release of active substances from these polyelectrolyte complex particles. 
</summary>

<summary> The invention is a golf ball teeing device that allows golfers to insert a tee into the ground with a ball on top without bending over. It eliminates the need for a manually controlled unclamping mechanism and can be attached to a golf club grip. The device is lightweight, portable, and easy to use, allowing golfers to tee up a ball and retrieve the tee without bending over. It is made of flexible plastic material and utilizes a delayed urging means to securely hold the ball and tee in place. </summary>

<summary> The source document describes a person support apparatus, such as a hospital bed, with a mechanism for adjusting the height and orientation of the patient support frame. The apparatus includes leg assemblies connected to the deck support frame, with actuators for adjusting the height and inclination of the frame. The deck support frame features inverted U-shaped channel elements on its sides, with rollers on the leg assemblies running along the inner surface of the channels. This design allows for smooth and stable movement of the deck support frame. The apparatus can be adjusted to raise, lower, or tilt the patient support surface, providing comfort and flexibility for patients and caregivers. Additionally, a braking mechanism is incorporated into the castors at the foot and head ends of the bed for added safety and stability. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a skin reflectance measuring apparatus specifically designed for measuring skin reflectance. It uses fiber optics for flexibility and miniaturization, allowing for measurements on small skin surfaces. The apparatus compensates for variations in emitted light and ambient light to provide accurate measurements. Reflectance values are calculated from specular and diffuse reflection measurements, with a scale defined from a matt surface of reference to a calibrated mirror. The apparatus includes a probe, measuring device, and display device for easy handling and immediate results. Calibration is performed to determine constants for accurate measurements. Tests have shown effective correlation between visual reflectance and measured values, validating the apparatus for quantifying skin reflectance.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that provides hydraulic cleaning of teeth and massaging of gums. The apparatus includes a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members, bite blocks, air-sacks for massaging, and hoses for water and suction. Control box allows for operation with air, water, or both, and a remote control device is provided for convenience. The apparatus is designed to provide effective cleaning and massaging for dental health. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, specifically addressing the issue of reliable anchoring of the mesh implant during surgical procedures for pelvic organ prolapse. The invention includes anterior and posterior implants with straps for threading into ligaments, as well as a specialized needle for threading the straps through tissues from the accessible side, improving surgical outcomes. </summary>

The second embodiment of the apparatus is designed to handle patients with varying respiratory mechanics, abnormal chemoreceptor reflexes, or hypoventilation syndromes. It includes features such as fuzzy logic algorithms for detecting sudden changes in leakage flow, adjusting the time constant for leak conductance calculations, and calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle. The apparatus also incorporates fuzzy inference rules for triggering pressure changes based on respiratory patterns and leak conditions. Overall, the apparatus aims to provide tailored ventilatory assistance to match the subject's respiratory needs.

<summary> The invention is an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures, with a rigid arm extending between the working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve to improve visibility of the operation site. The arm is laterally offset from the sleeve's longitudinal axis, preventing inadvertent cauterization of healthy tissue. The instrument includes different working tip electrode configurations, such as a hook or spatula, for various surgical applications. An insulating jacket covers the arm to prevent unintentional contact with surrounding tissue. The design allows for easy handling and use by surgeons, and the instrument can be connected to a conventional electro-surgical unit for controlled electrical energy supply. Variations in arm length and electrode configuration can be made to suit specific surgical needs. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus that allows for high-contrast exposures in a short time, even for larger body segments. The apparatus includes a support plate, transmit and receive coils, and an adjustment unit that determines adjustment parameters in a preceding process before executing exposures. By storing the adjustment parameters and quickly switching coil configurations during the examination, high-quality images are obtained with reduced examination times. The invention allows for tracking contrast agent doses over larger body regions without the need for multiple injections, improving patient safety and image quality. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a fastener for albums, such as photographic albums and scrapbooks, allowing for easy insertion and removal of pages. The fastener consists of strap anchors attached to the front and back covers, a strap passing through aligned apertures in the covers and pages, and a releasable connection between the strap and anchors to adjust the length for variable album thickness. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a lightweight and durable sulky designed for trotting races, with a frame, driver's seat, and shafts aligned with the wheels. Traditional steel sulkies have been heavy and difficult to transport, while attempts with aluminum have failed due to poor strength. The new design allows for easy assembly from flat elements, using casted and extruded components for stability and strength. The end frames are symmetrical and casted, with mounting bushings for the crossbar to ensure a stable connection. The sulky can be disassembled for storage and transportation, and easily assembled by the user with basic tools. Overall, the invention provides a lightweight, durable, and cost-effective solution for trotting races. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly in water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts. The system aims to remove air bubbles that can cause overheating and blockages in the cooling system. By providing bypasses with inlets around the axis of rotation, air bubbles are automatically removed by utilizing pressure gradients. Different embodiments of the bypasses are shown, including arrangements in end faces of feed pipes, as radially arranged pipes, and as coiled pipes. The bypasses are designed to increase hydrodynamic resistance to achieve adequate pressure drop with minimal flow resistance. Overall, the ventilation system is simple in design and construction, effectively removing air bubbles from rotating water feeds. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle with a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft and a retaining part connected across an energy absorption and break-away connection. The jacket unit is displaceable in the event of a crash to absorb energy. The retaining part is connected to the bracket unit in the closed state of the securement device. The energy absorption connection includes at least one bending wire or strip that is elastically prestressed to absorb energy during a crash. The break-away connection is released if the force exceeds a limit value. The steering column is adjustable in length and height or inclination. The prestress of the bending wire or strip helps decrease the force peak during a crash, providing a simple and cost-effective solution. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a method for installing flat, uncurved glass panels in curved window bays of vehicles. Traditional methods involve pre-contouring and tempering glass, making it brittle and less flexible. This new method allows for the glass to be flexed in situ to conform to the curved window opening. Resilient clips and a reveal molding are used to hold the glass panel in place temporarily. Adhesive sealant is then applied between the glass panel and the window opening, allowing the glass to be permanently fixed in its curved shape. The method is cost-effective, as flat glass panels are much cheaper than pre-treated, pre-contoured glass. The use of flat glass also provides better flexibility and shock absorption in the event of an accident. The invention is applicable to various vehicle windows and provides a secure and weatherproof installation method. </summary>

The invention is an apparatus for removing gas from a liquid, particularly oxygen from water on offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms. The apparatus includes a vessel with multiple gasification chambers, each with mechanisms for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid to displace the first gas. The method involves introducing the liquid into the chambers, ingesting the second gas, creating a turbulent area to displace the first gas, and removing the displaced gas from the vapor space of each chamber. The apparatus offers advantages such as reduced vessel height requirements, lower capital costs, and efficient removal of oxygen from water.

<summary> The disclosure relates to a packaging machine with multiple work stations arranged in succession, each with a movable tool member. The machine includes a shaft driven in the production direction, synchronizing the movements of the tool members. A transfer mechanism converts the shaft's rotational movement into the required tool movement. The transfer mechanism may include toggle levers or a cam mechanism with wear-reducing elements. The shaft can drive tool members for forming, sealing, and cutting stations. Work stations may be arranged on different vertical levels for a compact design. The machine frame supports the shaft, and tool members can be displaced without affecting the shaft. The disclosure allows for modifications and improvements in deep-drawing packaging machines. </summary>

The document describes a disposable finishing article assembly with a drive member permanently affixed to a grinding wheel, allowing for quick attachment and release to a power tool without the use of adhesives. The assembly includes a backing flange, a retaining nut, and a pressure cap to securely hold the grinding wheel in place during operation, providing smooth and vibration-free performance.

<summary> The invention is a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system that diverts pressure fluid entrained by pump pistons away from vulnerable electrical components. The unit includes a housing block, a motor, and a covering hood. Pressure fluid from the cam element chamber is diverted into spring chambers far from electrical components. A pressure equalization conduit between the spring chambers and the motor interior prevents water from entering and maintains pressure equilibrium. Different exemplary embodiments show variations in the design of the conduit system for diverting pressure fluid and maintaining pressure equilibrium. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to power and free conveyor systems for transferring carriers between predetermined paths. By providing selectively operable second and third dogs on the carriers, transfers can be achieved over short or long distances. The third dog is normally held out of operative position by the track but can be brought to operative position for transferring the carrier. The system allows for efficient and cost-effective transfers without changing the elevation of the tracks. The dogs can be operated simultaneously or sequentially to minimize the number of pushers on the conveyor chain and achieve desired transfer distances. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a conductive liner for railroad car center plate assemblies, eliminating the need for separate grounding apparatus. The liner is made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene mixed with 2% carbon black for conductivity. The liner fills the space between the center plate and truck bolster bowl, providing self-lubricating properties and electrical conductivity. Different embodiments include a dished bowl liner and a flat horizontal disk liner. The conductive liner improves mechanical properties, wear resistance, and electrical conductivity, meeting industry standards for static dissipation. The liner provides slip surfaces for swiveling action of the car trucks and eliminates the need for additional grounding apparatus. </summary>

<summary> This invention relates to a gate valve for dispensing viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches. The valve can be operated with one hand, making it ideal for fast-food restaurants. It features a tubular sleeve with a reciprocating gate that can be positioned over the discharge outlet. The gate and guide are curved to provide a tight seal when closed and unobstructed flow when open. The valve can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily. It is designed to be mounted on the spout of a bag and can be used in dispensers. The valve allows for gradual or quick opening and closing, providing effective sealing and cut-off. Overall, it offers a convenient and efficient solution for dispensing viscous substances. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a vehicular rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of a vehicle control output. The system includes a mirror control responsive to the vehicle control output, such as gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information. The mirror control uses a microcomputer to determine the protocol by monitoring the output and adjusting parameters based on the protocol. The system also includes light sensors to establish a value for the drive signal. The power-up sequence and main sequence routines in the software determine the protocol of the vehicle control output. The system allows for the same mirror system to be used in different vehicles with varying protocols. The software-based protocol determination technique reduces hardware expenses and can be implemented using an 8-bit register. Changes and modifications can be made without departing from the principles of the invention. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, specifically focusing on systems for the front wheel. The system includes an anti-dive device in the front suspension to control the contraction of the front fork in response to braking force. This helps to minimize variations in angular deceleration of the front wheel and improve braking efficiency. The system also includes an anti-lock control unit to regulate hydraulic pressure to prevent wheel lock. The anti-dive device works in conjunction with the anti-lock control unit to enhance braking performance and reduce chassis vibration. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to movable partitions and panels for separating or insulating cargo during transportation. It addresses the issue of maintaining different temperatures in cargo areas within refrigerated trailers. The improved partition system includes panels that can be independently moved and attached to mounting assemblies. The panels can slide along rails, be raised and secured to the ceiling when not in use, and be hingedly attached for rotational movement. The system allows for efficient compartmentalization of cargo areas and reduces strain on temperature control systems. Various modifications can be made to the system without departing from the invention, providing flexibility in design and functionality. The panels can be used independently or together to create different cargo areas, and can be secured using straps, buckles, or other mechanisms. Overall, the invention offers a versatile and efficient solution for multi-temperature transport in refrigerated trailers. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve designed for use in liquid chromatography to separate and purify biological macromolecules. The valve features a novel diaphragm seal that allows for in-place sanitization without disassembly. The valve is designed to be used in conjunction with a carousel system for continuous simulated counter-current flow, improving efficiency and reducing liquid consumption. The invention provides a solution for maintaining sterile conditions in the process system while maximizing the lifespan and efficiency of the solid phase beds used in chromatography. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies for improved efficiency. The invention addresses the problem of restricted disengagement of vapor retained in the liquid on trays. Directional thrust valves are incorporated to control liquid flow and enhance vapor-liquid contact. The valves are circular discs with wider frontal legs to divert liquid flow around the aperture. The design reduces back-trapping of liquid and promotes directional thrust of vapor. The method and apparatus provide increased efficiency in gas-liquid contact in process columns. Various embodiments of the valve-tray assembly are described for enhanced vapor-liquid flow and efficiency. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. It aims to reduce variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure, is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain, lightweight, and portable. The assembly includes a vane pump to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical power. The vane motor is designed to efficiently translate fluid pressure into mechanical motion, driving a generator to produce electricity. The assembly can be used in various applications, such as in a gas grill, scuba diving gear, or vehicles powered by pressurized fluids. The design allows for the extraction of work from pressurized fluids while reducing pressure, potentially leading to the use of smaller and more cost-effective regulators. Modifications and variations are possible to adapt the assembly to different pressure levels and applications.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a pallet system designed to support and secure trays loaded with items for shipping. The pallet system includes raised guide rails to prevent lateral movement of the trays, end stops to limit longitudinal movement, and end plates for added stability and protection. The trays can be easily loaded and unloaded by sliding them onto the pallet along the guide rails. The components of the pallet system, such as the pallet cap and end plates, are customizable for different types of loads. Various features, materials, and manufacturing methods are utilized to optimize the functionality and efficiency of the pallet system. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension for aviation aircrafts. The design focuses on compact structure, reasonable layout, high efficiency, and easy control of the rotary-wing system. The magnetic suspension system includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, magnetic suspension shaft, and guide rail. The rotary-wing system is designed to avoid contact and friction within the saucer shell, reduce noise and vibration, and increase power efficiency. Two improvement solutions are proposed to overcome reactive torque and ensure stable power control. The design includes radial and axial magnetic suspension structures for the rotary-wing wheels, as well as a permanent magnet synchronous electric engine. Coaxial axial and radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems are also introduced for enhanced power performance and stability.</summary>

<summary> The present invention involves streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, produced through recombinant DNA technology. These muteins are used for isolating, purifying, and determining biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins. The muteins were identified through a screening process involving fusion proteins and fluorescence titration. Affinity chromatography was used to purify fusion proteins using the streptavidin muteins, which showed higher binding affinity compared to wild-type streptavidin. The invention also includes vectors, cells, and reagent kits for utilizing the streptavidin muteins in various applications. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, particularly nickel in the zero oxidation state. Guanidines are important in drug development due to their biological activity. The methods involve guanylating amines or pyrrolidines with guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas. The reactions are carried out under mild conditions and in high yields, minimizing reagents and toxic compounds. Various protected thioureas and isothioureas are used as guanylating agents, with nickel catalysts like nickel-boride alloys being effective. The reactions can be carried out in various solvents and at different temperatures, resulting in high yields of guanidines. Nickel catalysts in varying molar concentrations and different forms have been tested, all showing effectiveness in catalyzing the guanylation reactions. Overall, the methods provide a cost-effective and efficient way to synthesize substituted guanidines for pharmaceutical applications.</summary>

The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires, providing colored oxide coatings with excellent weatherability. The process involves anodizing the aluminum strip or wire in an anodic oxidation bath, then electrolytically coloring the anodized coating in a bath containing specific acids or metal salts. The apparatus includes baths for degreasing, etching, anodic oxidation, electrolytic coloring, and sealing, with the aluminum strip or wire continuously passing through each bath. By controlling the electric current, bath composition, and immersion time, various colors can be achieved on the aluminum strips or wires.

<summary> The present invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants by assembling a DNA sequence of interest in planta from precursor vectors. This process allows for the rapid and efficient transformation of plant cells with desired genetic sequences. The assembly of the DNA sequence of interest can involve multiple precursor vectors and the use of site-specific recombination. Selectable markers and counter-selectable markers can be used to identify and remove transformed plant cells containing precursor vector sequences. The process enables the screening of DNA libraries, optimization of gene expression, and the creation of complex DNA sequences for stable integration into plant chromosomes. The use of different recombinases and integrases can facilitate the assembly of diverse DNA sequences of interest. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas by rotating a swash plate, with an improvement of applying a fluorocarbon coating to reduce frictional wear. Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning systems for years, with the need for coatings to reduce wear on the components. Prior coatings required expensive materials and complex processes, leading to the development of a new coating that is both friction-reducing and highly durable. The coating is applied to the swash plate using a polyfluoro elastomer, lubricious additive, and load bearing additive, providing durability and low friction properties. Experimental results show that the coated swash plates have higher seizure loads and lower friction coefficients compared to uncoated or tin-coated swash plates. The coating process does not require high surface finishing, making it suitable for use on lower cost aluminum materials. Overall, the coating improves the efficiency and durability of swash plate compressors. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to organic polymers for anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, specifically for preventing light reflection during photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources. The polymers absorb light at 193 nm and 248 nm wavelengths, eliminating standing wave effects and reflection/diffraction. The invention provides novel chemical compounds, preparation methods, anti-reflective coating compositions, and coating formation methods. Polymers are synthesized with diazonaphthoquinonesulfonyl groups, and compositions may include light-absorbing compounds. The polymers form a cross-linked structure when coated and baked, providing stable anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices. The use of these polymers improves product yield and stability in submicro-pattern formation processes for semiconductors.</summary>

<summary> The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with good orientability and mechanical properties. The film includes white pigment, flame retardant, and UV absorber, and can be produced cost-effectively. The film passes fire tests and has high UV resistance, good optical and mechanical properties, and can be thermoformed without predrying. The film is suitable for various applications and can be recycled without loss of properties. </summary>

<summary> The present invention describes a method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) through continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis. The process achieves very high conversion and selectivity for 143a, exceeding 99%. Various catalysts, including CrF3 and Cr/Ni/AlF3, are used to facilitate the hydrofluorination process. The catalysts are activated and tested under different conditions, such as temperature, pressure, and contact time. The process demonstrates efficient removal of olefinic byproducts, such as 1130a, 1131a, and 1132a, from the final product. The adiabatic reactor setup is utilized to optimize the hydrofluorination process at different feed rates and pressures. Overall, the method provides a practical and economical approach to manufacturing 143a with high purity and minimal byproducts. </summary>

<summary> This invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of pyrazolotriazoles using hypophosphorous acid to reduce impurities and increase yield. The process involves reacting acylated compounds with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid to produce the desired pyrazolotriazoles. The use of hypophosphorous acid results in less elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing impurities. The compounds used in the process have inert substituents that are stable and non-reactive under the reaction conditions. The process includes acylation, deacylation, and desulfurization steps conducted at specific temperatures and pressures. The resulting pyrazolotriazoles can be isolated using known techniques. The invention provides a significant advance in the synthesis of pyrazolotriazoles for use in photographic products. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots. The method involves measuring the total quantity of fiber in each lot, determining a partial quantity to be removed, and continuously removing only the calculated quantity from each lot. The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device to ensure precise removal of fiber quantities. The method eliminates fiber residuals, ensures an optimally homogeneous mixture, and can be time-controlled to maintain a predetermined schedule for fiber removal.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at angles of 30Â° to 150Â° to the long axis of the fabric. Traditional fabric formation methods like knitting and weaving are not suitable for modern uses requiring structural strength. Non-woven fabrics are developed for these purposes, with layers held together by stitching or adhesive bonding. The invention involves a rake mechanism synchronized with conveyors to ensure parallelism of yarns in each layer, with the ability to overlap courses for increased density. The apparatus includes conveyors with needles, yarn carriers, and rake systems to lay yarns in a controlled manner. The resulting fabric can be used for structural parts, impregnated with resin, and cured for strength. Various bonding methods can be used, and loops formed during fabrication can be cut away after bonding.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with varying weft carrying forces. Prior looms used uniform air pressure for all weft threads, resulting in wasted air and varying insertion speeds. The invention allows for different air pressures or ejection times to produce appropriate weft carrying forces for each weft thread. Different embodiments show variations in subnozzle arrangements, pressure regulation, and main nozzle control. The system ensures stable weft insertion, reduced air consumption, and improved efficiency in weaving different types of fabric. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process involving health-preserving the fibres to improve flexibility and reduce breakage rates. The process includes steps such as opening, cleaning, carding, and spinning the fibres, with variations in temperature, humidity, and duration of health preservation. Various experiments with different fibre blends and preservation conditions show a significant reduction in end breakage rates, improving work efficiency and product quality. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to nip presses used in various industries, particularly in papermaking, to measure and remove rotational variability from the nip pressure profile. The invention involves placing multiple sets of sensors at different cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to measure pressure as it enters the nip region. By averaging the readings from corresponding sensors at each position, a more accurate nip pressure profile can be calculated. Different configurations of sensors, such as pairs spaced 180Â° apart or sets spaced 120Â° or 90Â° apart, can be used to cancel out rotational variability. The sensors can be connected to a transmitter for wireless data transmission to a processing unit, which can display the nip pressure profile and make corrective adjustments to the sensing roll. Graphical displays show how different sensor configurations can reduce rotational variability and improve the accuracy of the nip pressure profile. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board. The apparatus includes a clamp for securing it to the ironing board, a flexible cord support for supporting the electrical cord of an iron, and a detachable article holder. The clamp has a threaded bolt for adjusting the clamp to the ironing board and an electrical outlet for the iron's plug. The cord support has a flexible mast with a spring section and a foot for pivotable movement. The article holder has a circular hoop with support bars and vertical supports for holding items. The apparatus can be disassembled for storage by retracting the cord support and removing the article holder. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can be adjusted to sew buttonholes of different lengths based on the type of material being used. The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly with a slidable member for positioning a button, and an adjustable stop to control the length of the buttonhole. By adjusting the stop, operators can ensure that buttonholes are sewn without overlap and with precise closure points, regardless of the material being used. </summary>

The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, using a conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch. The textile web is transported on an endless sieve belt, with liquid applied at one station and removed by suction at another station. The dwell stretch ensures the textile web is spread out and single-layered for effective treatment. Different embodiments of the apparatus are described, including one with an air pass and another with a sieve drum for guiding the textile web. The apparatus allows for improved washing or rinsing without stacking the textile web, resulting in a more efficient and gentle treatment process. The invention provides a compact and versatile solution for fabric treatment applications.

<summary> The document describes a dry cleaning machine with separate air flow and solvent flow systems, controlled by a timer, to minimize the escape of solvent vapors and ensure efficient cleaning and drying of clothes. The machine includes a refrigeration system for condensing solvent vapors, controls for a "cartridge dry" operation to dry filter cartridges, and safety features to prevent solvent vapor leakage. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly in the production of nonwoven webs. The system involves a quench chamber and a two-dimensional slot across the machine width for filament impingement, providing uniform filament distribution and control of cross-machine uniformity. The system uses quench air for both cooling the filaments and drawing them through the slot, resulting in high filament velocities and improved web formation control. The method allows for easy adjustment of filament denier by changing slot openings or air flow rates. The system also incorporates aspects of meltblown processes for improved web formation. Test results demonstrate the efficiency and flexibility of the system in producing nonwoven fabrics with various properties. Overall, the method and apparatus offer a simple, efficient, and flexible solution for forming fine continuous filaments and nonwoven webs. </summary>

<summary> The document describes a sewing machine system that allows users to easily specify a sewing position on a work cloth using an ultrasonic pen. The system includes receivers on the sewing machine or embroidery unit that detect ultrasonic waves transmitted from the pen. The sewing machine calculates the specified coordinates based on the detection timings of the receivers. In one embodiment, the ultrasonic pen has an electromagnetic wave output circuit, while in another embodiment, the pen transmits ultrasonic waves. The system accurately identifies the specified position and starts sewing accordingly. The receivers are strategically positioned to ensure accurate detection of the ultrasonic waves. The system provides a convenient and efficient way for users to specify sewing positions without the need for markers or manual measurements. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by using ultrafine wool powder or bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives. The preparations provide improved functional durability, including enhanced ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, moisture management, and wrinkle resistance, when applied to cellulosic fabric materials. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is an automatic quilting machine for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads and quilts. It utilizes separate computers to control the sewing machine functions and the frame table movements, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function. The system includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns, simplifying the process of programming and modifying patterns. By segregating the control of sewing functions and table movements, the invention increases efficiency and productivity in quilting operations. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image for various consumer applications. Traditional textile fabric production involves multiple steps, while nonwoven fabrics are more efficient as they are produced directly from the carding process. Nonwoven fabrics can be reinforced with support layers like spunbond material to improve physical properties. The invention involves forming a nonwoven fabric from two precursor webs with a support layer in between, then subjecting it to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device. The resulting fabric exhibits a pronounced image and specific physical characteristics suitable for various applications. The method includes pre-entangling the precursor webs, imaging them, and optionally treating the fabric with performance or aesthetic modifying compositions. The fabric can be used in hygiene products, medical applications, cleaning wipes, protective wear, and apparel construction.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric. It includes a stop in the feed path of the strip that can be retracted and controlled by a signal transmitter. The device ensures continuous operation, can handle stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances. The device operates by moving the stop into position when the strip is fed correctly, triggering the necessary switching processes for starting the sewing operation. The invention provides a simple, rugged, and economical solution for feeding strip materials in sewing machines. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a knitting method and knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments. Traditional methods involve sewing the knit fabric together, leading to increased thickness and decreased productivity. The new method involves knitting two tape-shaped pieces on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds, overlaying loops, and gradually binding off to connect the pieces. The process is repeated until the two pieces are fully connected. The method prevents loose stitching at the junction and improves the appearance and comfort of the garment. The detailed description includes diagrams illustrating the knitting process step by step. The method can be applied to various garments such as sweaters, tank tops, and aprons. The invention allows for automated control of the knitting pattern using a computer. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, comprising stranded cables sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material. A production line is described for embedding the cables in the material, ensuring precise positioning and adhesion. The method involves preheating the cables, sheathing them in the extruder with the material, and cooling the resulting traction element. The resulting traction elements are flexible, durable, and suitable for various applications, such as lift bands. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, designed to minimize hindrance to the guiding and pull-back of the needle thread loop. The arrangement includes cams and a spring rod to prevent rotation of the bobbin housing, as well as a capsule release device for counter-rotating the bobbin housing. This design allows for smooth and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, with minimal impediment during the sewing process. The use of the capsule release device reduces the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation. Overall, the rotary hook arrangement is simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture, providing improved sewing properties compared to conventional rotary hooks. </summary>

<summary> The invention provides methods for producing silicon-based nanowire materials using four-component and five-component liquid silane inks. These inks are electrospun to form continuous fibers that are deposited onto a substrate and transformed through thermal or laser processing. The resulting silicon-based nanowires can be used in a variety of applications, such as composite materials for electrodes in lithium-ion batteries. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each equipped with a brake rotor and adjustable braking element controlled by a tensioning lever biased by the departing thread. Existing creel arrangements automatically decrease braking force as spool wind diameter reduces. The invention allows for individual and overall thread tension control in the creel using fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangements connected to the tensioning levers. A pneumatic biasing arrangement influences the tensioning lever without hindering its movement. The tensioning lever can also operate a brake shoe for rapid braking action. An alternate embodiment replaces the friction brake with an electromagnetic brake for more precise control of braking force. By adjusting the biasing arrangements, thread tension can be globally altered, and rapid braking can be achieved by engaging the brake shoe. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a sewing machine detector that detects the position of the sewing needle and the speed of the machine. It includes flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs mounted on a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft. Optical fibers are used to transmit and receive light for detection purposes, with reflecting portions ensuring accurate optical axes. The detector reduces stress on the optical fibers, provides stable signal detection, and includes a power indicating light that does not interfere with the control circuit. Overall, the invention offers a durable, compact, and efficient solution for detecting sewing machine control signals. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness. The process involves completing coagulation, washing with water of non-alkaline pH, and drying the yarn. The degree of white is measured using the Hunter method. The process results in a yarn with a high degree of white without the need for additional treatments. The wash water used should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from certain cations. The process is carried out at spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min. The invention simplifies the spinning process, accelerates it, and reduces space take-up of spinning machines. The process involves specific treatments to achieve a high degree of white in the finished yarn. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a deaeration tank for washing pulp after oxygen bleaching, solving the problem of foam formation in the washer. The tank is small, with no moving parts, and can be placed on top of an oxygen reactor. It has an inlet pipe, outlet, and swirl inducing inlet pipe for optimal deaeration. The system uses filtrate from the washer as the swirling fluid in the tank. The tank is cylindrical, closed, and can withstand pressure or vacuum. The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a sensor, and the body of slurry is swirled by the filtrate. The tank is designed for efficient deaeration of pulp before washing, improving the overall bleaching process. </summary>

The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. The materials are designed using a function-oriented material design process, optimizing the material distribution for specific functions and loading conditions. The BTR composites consist of tendon elements, stuffer members, joints, flesh, skin, and shell components, providing a wide range of structural configurations and applications.

<summary> The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures to dissipate energy during dynamic events. The device may undergo plastic deformation to limit loads on the structure and can be easily replaced after deformation. The device is designed to withstand high lateral loads and form plastic hinges to dissipate energy. Different geometries of the device can be used for various bracing configurations, and it can be externally mounted on structures. An indicator may be used to detect plastic deformation after a dynamic event. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities in existing buildings. The bedroom cabinet is assembled in a box shape with an outer casing and an inner casing, providing mechanical strength. Boxes for devices and shelves for belongings are integrated within the cabinet without protruding, maximizing dwelling area. The outer surfaces of the cabinet are flat, allowing for easy stacking or installation of multiple cabinets. A clearance between the outer and inner casings houses wiring and provides ventilation for natural airflow and soundproofing. The cabinet features various compartments, including shelves, an inclined backrest, and storage boxes for devices. The assembly process involves fitting the inner casing into the outer casing and securing them with clip members and an ornamental web. A second embodiment includes spacer members for added strength and ventilation throughout the cabinet. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a portable guard rail support for use in construction sites to provide safety barriers. The guard rail support includes rail supporting brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The system allows for easy assembly and disassembly, meets safety guidelines, and can be used in various construction environments. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods. The method involves generating acoustic and electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to enhance oil flow and increase oil recovery. Various categories of methods for stimulating reservoirs are discussed, including electrical, heating, mechanical fracturing, and acoustic methods. The invention uses a combination of direct electrohydraulic and electromagnetic pulses to stimulate reservoirs at different scales. The range of effectiveness of the stimulation is extended by using multiple sources in multiple wells and adjusting pulse characteristics. The invention also includes methods for separating components of the recovered fluids, such as hydrocarbons, gases, water, and impurities. Various separation processes, including membrane separation, fractionation, cryogenic separation, and solvent extraction, are discussed for separating components of the recovered fluids. The invention also addresses electrode wear in electrohydraulic devices and includes methods for improving electrode durability. Overall, the invention provides a comprehensive approach to enhancing oil recovery from reservoirs using advanced stimulation techniques and separation processes.</summary>

<summary> The document describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures. The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip. A connective device secures the splice, preventing the transverse wires from escaping. Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to create a composite soil reinforcing element of desired length. The disclosure provides a detailed description of the splice design and its application in MSE structures. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a plow blade design with fluid passage and ejection points for efficient installation of utility lines. Different embodiments include variations in the placement of the fluid tube, leading edge sections, and nozzles to control fluid flow rates and locations. The design allows for easy customization and efficient production using traditional manufacturing processes. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a building system for stucco type cavity wall construction, allowing for panels of greater height and width without movement joints. The system includes battens, mesh reinforcement, and a plaster matrix applied in multiple layers. Various components such as flashings, mesh, battens, and plaster materials are specified for use in the system. Movement control joints are required at specific locations to accommodate for changes in elevation and height. The system is designed to meet building code requirements for structural integrity, durability, fire resistance, and external moisture protection. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a safe with a valuables chamber and a steel door that can be easily assembled and locked securely. The door is inserted at an angle and then laterally displaced into grooves on the walls of the safe. The lockbolt engages a detent in one of the grooves, while safety bolts prevent damage to the lock mechanism in case of forced intrusion. The safe can be constructed with a liner and concrete or with a steel fabrication method. The design allows for efficient locking and protection against prying, with variations possible in the door configuration and safety features. Overall, the invention provides a simple yet effective door and safe structure for securing valuable items. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to monitoring fluid pressures in geological formations accurately and without being influenced by pressures in the formation above and below the measuring apparatus. Traditional piezometers and pressure transducers have limitations in accurately measuring formation pressures. The invention involves cementing a conduit with a filter at the bottom end in a borehole, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and creating a fluid connection between the filter and the formation pressure to be measured. The method isolates the pressure sensor in the borehole and allows for accurate measurement of formation pressures at a desired depth. The invention also includes a method for monitoring fluid pressure in a subterranean formation by forming a borehole, placing a conduit with a pressure sensing device at the desired depth, and creating a fluid connection to the formation pressure. The system allows for precise measurement of formation pressures and can be adapted for different reservoir types. The method involves fracturing the formation to establish a fluid connection between the filter and the pressure transducer. The invention provides a reliable and accurate system for monitoring fluid pressures in geological formations. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member. It aims to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensure smooth vehicle traveling, and facilitate maintenance. The structure includes laminated rubbers, a joint block, and supporting blocks, all fitted in detachable fashion. The method involves joining the elastic members, fixing them in place, and allowing for deformation to absorb bridge girder expansion or contraction.</summary>

The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting wheeled hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the environment, allowing for the quick cooling of meat products with a brine solution. The system prevents the brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels, facilitating the recovery and reuse of the solution without the need for decontamination.

<summary> The lock device described in the source document is designed to prevent a work machine, such as a backhoe boom, from tilting due to its weight. The device includes an engaging member on the boom or boom bracket, an engaged member on the other, and a guide member to keep the engaging member in place. The lock plate can be easily operated manually, and features a slip-prevention mechanism for secure assembly. This lock device is suitable for use in various work machines, such as excavators, loaders, and cranes. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for adjustable suction efficiency. The apparatus includes adjustment mechanisms on the vacuum head to regulate the spacing between the suction portion and the pool bottom, enabling real-time suction adjustment without needing to adjust the suction source. The invention can be easily added to existing pool cleaning devices, providing a simple and cost-effective solution for regulating suction during pool cleaning operations. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools. The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel, upper collar section, and threadably removable lower collar section. A retriever section is circular in shape and slidably movable between the end collars of the sub-unit. The retriever section is adapted with protruding members for engaging a wear bushing. Grooves on the mandrel prevent rotational movement of the retriever section. The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit to prevent damage. The retriever unit can be mounted onto drill pipe without removing the drill bit. An additional embodiment includes a retriever section with a threaded lower end for engaging threaded wear bushings. The invention provides a simple and inexpensive solution for retrieving wear bushings during drilling operations. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows passage for wireline or other tools to pass through and can be closed by landing a plug on a seat. The tool features modular stacked piston units to increase power delivery, an annular dump valve to prevent slamming against a seat, and a simple plug for activation. The design eliminates impacts on valve components, allows for longer trouble-free service, and provides the capability to operate with or without impacts on each cycle. The tool can be used for various downhole operations, including releasing stuck objects, stimulation, and fishing operations, and includes a rotational lock for torque transmission. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to a precast concrete retaining wall system with a face panel and integral counterfort for increased stability. The system allows for taller walls and shorter bases, with pre-manufactured components that can be easily assembled on site. The connection between the face panel and base is made with grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring during installation. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of oil or gas wells to improve production. Existing down hole heating systems have shortcomings in focusing heat and protecting electrical components from damage. The invention addresses these issues by containing heat in the production zone and shielding electrical connections. The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods, heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, and stainless steel collars. The method involves using the system to treat oil or gas wells with high viscosity or paraffin blockage conditions, resulting in increased flow rates and improved production. Modifications and alternative embodiments of the invention are also contemplated.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, especially those that are stuck or lost. The mechanism includes an external pull tool or overshot and an internal pull tool or spear, both with a catch mechanism for locking and unlocking. The mechanism allows for controlled connection and disconnection with objects in the well bore without the need for jarring or mechanical vibration. The overshot mechanism includes a latching control element and guide pins for latching and unlatching the collet structure. The mechanism can be used for various down hole service operations, such as fishing for stuck tools, and can be easily replaced with a heavier duty tool if needed. The invention provides a simple and efficient way to handle objects in wells, improving the effectiveness and safety of well servicing operations.</summary>

<summary> The example embodiment relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved durability. The method involves using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means include dendrites, adhesion, horizontal reinforcement means, and vertical reinforcement means to prevent displacement or deformation. The example embodiment aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the floors, providing increased durability and the ability for corrective maintenance. The method addresses drawbacks of conventional stave floors, offering a solution for enhancing the lifespan and quality of composed stave floors.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to ladder attachments that provide stability, prevent slipping, and protect work surfaces. Traditional ladders can damage surfaces and lack stability, especially on corners. The attachment includes a brace with a large contact area, a U-bolt, and a resilient pad assembly. The brace can be adjusted to straddle corners and increase stability. The design allows for easy installation and can be adapted for different ladder types. Overall, the invention improves ladder safety, stability, and protection of work surfaces. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, reducing debris generation and increasing holding power. Various configurations of the collation system, including tapered collars, embossed patterns, and selectively weakened regions, are designed to minimize debris and enhance performance. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle includes a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button with channels and orifices for precise sealant application. It allows for manual or automated sealant application, improving efficiency and quality in sealing operations. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a position sensor system for monitoring moving objects in mechanical systems. The system includes a waveform generator, error correction generator, and sensor monitoring equipment for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires. The system eliminates static signals and error signals, constantly compares sensor output to a desired minimum value, and generates correction signals to deliver accurate position information. The sensor system operates with a window reference circuit, a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation, and a DAC and counter combination for precise calibration. Overall, the system provides efficient and reliable monitoring of object positions with minimal energy consumption. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in internal combustion engines. The system eliminates the need for springs and allows for infinitely variable valve displacement. By controlling the valve port opening, the system can improve engine performance and fuel efficiency. The system consists of a rotating cam, translating means, and controllable actuating mechanisms for precise valve control. Computer control allows for optimal valve operation based on vehicle performance. The system can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, offering a simple, robust, and efficient solution for internal combustion engines. Overall, the invention aims to reduce gas consumption, improve engine performance, and provide precise and timely valve control. </summary>

<summary> The source document describes a light member for aquariums and other applications, using LEDs for lighting. The light member includes a housing with a top and bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side with control channels for different colors of light. Modules with LEDs emitting white or blue light can be coupled to the lighting control region. The modules have electrical connectors that couple to the control channels. The light member can be controlled manually with switches, remotely with RF technology, or with in-line timers. The light member can also be used under cabinets, with multiple light members linked together in series. Optics elements can be added to the light member to change the angle or focus of the light emitted. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, such as a gas turbine blade. Traditional flow deflection apparatuses use internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperatures. The invention introduces separate inserts for separating walls, replacing the need for cast walls. These inserts are inserted into the apparatus and secured, offering advantages such as reduced weight, simplified production, and improved cooling efficiency. The inserts can be straight or bent into a U-shape for deflection. The flow deflection apparatus can be a blade in a gas turbine, with holders in the form of rails for securing the inserts. The separating walls can be connected by soldering or welding for added security. The invention simplifies assembly, reduces thermal stresses, and allows for easy adjustment of the cooling system. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for automatic or manual control. The system includes a control unit that processes signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position to set the throttle for optimal performance. A DC motor or stepper motor is used to control the throttle valve based on the signals processed by the control unit. The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall. Manual control is achieved by engaging a clutch to connect the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve. The system ensures full operation of the vehicle in manual mode and does not compromise safety. The control system can also be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission for optimal performance. Various subroutines and logic sequencers are used to control the operation of the system. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste. Conventional hog fuel burners are inefficient and produce high levels of pollution, requiring frequent cleaning. The waste fuel burner described in the document emits minimal particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and can burn wet wood with high moisture content. The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to load changes. By utilizing primary and secondary combustion chambers with controlled air flow, the burner can effectively burn various fuels and remove particulate matter to meet environmental standards. </summary>

The invention pertains to an evaporative refrigeration system that separates evaporating water from the cooling air stream, achieving sensible cooling without adding water vapor. The system utilizes return air from the load as the working fluid for evaporation, resulting in efficient cooling with a lower energy cost compared to vapor compression refrigeration units. A hybrid system is also described, where a portion of the cooled air stream is further cooled by a vapor compression refrigeration unit, providing dehumidification and additional cooling efficiency.

<summary> The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series to pump fluid from a reservoir. Each pump head has an impeller driven by a common drive structure passing through the pump heads. The pump heads are connected by combiners to combine fluid flow from multiple conduits into a single flow. The pump can be mounted on support structures like a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer for operation at a fluid reservoir. The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance, with the drive train passing through the fluid flow path between pump heads. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing excess components and improving engine robustness. The engine includes an engine housing with a plurality of cylinders, each with a movable piston and connected to hydraulically and mechanically actuated devices. A portion of the cylinders have engine compression release brakes connected to the exhaust valve for engine braking. The engine brake system includes a solenoid, valve members, and a piston to control the opening and closing of the exhaust valve during engine braking. The electronic control module determines when engine braking is needed and activates the engine brakes for the desired braking horsepower. The engine brakes are modular and can be customized for specific applications, providing flexibility and cost-effectiveness. The operation of the engine brake system is described in detail, including the activation and deactivation process. Modifications to the engine brake system are possible to accommodate different engine configurations and orientations. Overall, the invention offers a versatile and efficient engine compression release brake system for improved engine performance. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads such as blade-off events. The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain the male and female links. The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface to dampen motion. The mounting link can absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine. The pin serves as a fusible link that shears at a known load magnitude, allowing the female and male links to translate relative to each other. The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation. The use of the pin and coulomb damping eliminates the need for all linkages to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements. The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to archery equipment and methods for attaching arrow points and balancing arrow shafts. The point cap system provides adjustable weight for perfect balance, reducing material and weight of arrow points. A balance pin can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft, working in conjunction with the point cap. Means are provided to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter. The invention also includes a point adaptor for attaching arrow points and a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to arrow shafts. The use of external threads at the end of the cap reduces stress on graphite shafts. The balance pin can be used with arrow points or point caps to adjust point weight. The disclosure provides details on the construction and attachment methods of the various components. </summary>

The invention is a cost-effective pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training, utilizing an electronically controlled system with plastic expendables containing pyrotechnic charges. The simulator provides a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber, and is designed for use with actual weapons for training purposes.
